snippet: A classified report says that many units are deeply infiltrated by either Sunni extremist informants or Shiite personnel backed by Iran, according to U.S. officials.
abstract: Classified military assessment finds that Iraq's security forces are so deeply infiltrated by Sunni extremist informants and Iran-backed Shiite personnel that any Americans assigned to advise them would face dire safety risks; report complicates dilemma faced by White House as it decides whether to send advisers, weaponry and surveillance systems to help Iraq's government confront ISIS militants.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and MICHAEL R. GORDON

lead_paragraph: A classified report says that many units are deeply infiltrated by either Sunni extremist informants or Shiite personnel backed by Iran, according to U.S. officials.

headline.main: U.S. Sees Risks in Assisting a Compromised Iraqi Force
headline.print_headline: U.S. Sees Risks in Assisting a Compromised Iraqi Force

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
